speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE II. Another room in the castle.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Safely stowed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: ROSENCRANTZ:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: GUILDENSTERN:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Within]  Hamlet! Lord Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What noise? who calls on Hamlet?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, here they come.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: What have you done, my lord, with the dead body?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Compounded it with dust, whereto 'tis kin.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Tell us where 'tis, that we may take it thence

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: And bear it to the chapel.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do not believe it.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Believe what?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I can keep your counsel and not mine own.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Besides, to be demanded of a sponge! what

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: replication should be made by the son of a king?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Take you me for a sponge, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, sir, that soaks up the king's countenance, his

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: king best service in the end: he keeps them, like

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: an ape, in the corner of his jaw; first mouthed, to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: be last swallowed: when he needs what you have

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: shall be dry again.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: I understand you not, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I am glad of it: a knavish speech sleeps in a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: foolish ear.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: with us to the king.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The body is with the king, but the king is not with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the body. The king is a thing--

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: A thing, my lord!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of nothing: bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt
